cards.name: A-Winota, Joiner of Forces
cards.text: Whenever one or more non-Human creatures you control attack, look at the top six cards of your library. You may put a Human creature card from among them onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. It gains indestructible until end of turn. Put the rest of the cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Adeline, Resplendent Cathar
cards.text:
Vigilance
Adeline's power is equal to the number of creatures you control.
Whenever you attack, for each opponent, create a 1/1 white Human creature token that's tapped and attacking that player or a planeswalker they control.

cards.name: Ranger-Captain of Eos
cards.text:
When this creature enters, you may search your library for a creature card with mana value 1 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Sacrifice this creature: Your opponents can't cast noncreature spells this turn.

cards.name: Sram, Senior Edificer
cards.text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Urza, Lord High Artificer
cards.text:
When Urza enters, create a 0/0 colorless Construct artifact creature token with "This token gets +1/+1 for each artifact you control."
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Add {U}.
{5}: Shuffle your library, then exile the top card. Until end of turn, you may play that card without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Venser, Shaper Savant
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Venser enters, return target spell or permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Bolas's Citadel
cards.text:
You may look at the top card of your library any time.
You may play lands and cast spells from the top of your library. If you cast a spell this way, pay life equal to its mana value rather than pay its mana cost.
{T}, Sacrifice ten nonland permanents: Each opponent loses 10 life.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

cards.name: Fatal Push
cards.text:
Destroy target creature if it has mana value 2 or less.
Revolt - Destroy that creature if it has mana value 4 or less instead if a permanent left the battlefield under your control this turn.

cards.name: Syr Konrad, the Grim
cards.text:
Whenever another creature dies, or a creature card is put into a graveyard from anywhere other than the battlefield, or a creature card leaves your graveyard, Syr Konrad deals 1 damage to each opponent.
{1}{B}: Each player mills a card. (They each put the top card of their library into their graveyard.)

cards.name: Yawgmoth, Thran Physician
cards.text:
Protection from Humans
Pay 1 life, Sacrifice another creature: Put a -1/-1 counter on up to one target creature and draw a card.
{B}{B}, Discard a card: Proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

cards.name: Ancient Copper Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, roll a d20. You create a number of Treasure tokens equal to the result.

cards.name: Godo, Bandit Warlord
cards.text:
When Godo enters, you may search your library for an Equipment card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Whenever Godo attacks for the first time each turn, untap it and all Samurai you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Purphoros, God of the Forge
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to red is less than five, Purphoros isn't a creature.
Whenever another creature you control enters, Purphoros deals 2 damage to each opponent.
{2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
cards.text: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.

cards.name: Nyxbloom Ancient
cards.text:
Trample
If you tap a permanent for mana, it produces three times as much of that mana instead.

cards.name: Jodah, the Unifier
cards.text:
Legendary creatures you control get +X/+X, where X is the number of legendary creatures you control.
Whenever you cast a legendary spell from your hand, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a legendary nonland card with lesser mana value. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Tymna the Weaver
cards.text:
Lifelink
At the beginning of each of your postcombat main phases, you may pay X life, where X is the number of opponents that were dealt combat damage this turn. If you do, draw X cards.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

cards.name: Winota, Joiner of Forces
cards.text: Whenever a non-Human creature you control attacks, look at the top six cards of your library. You may put a Human creature card from among them onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. It gains indestructible until end of turn. Put the rest of the cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Traxos, Scourge of Kroog
cards.text:
Trample
Traxos enters tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a historic spell, untap Traxos. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Akroma's Will
cards.text:
Choose one. If you control a commander as you cast this spell, you may choose both instead.
• Creatures you control gain flying, vigilance, and double strike until end of turn.
• Creatures you control gain lifelink, indestructible, and protection from each color until end of turn.

cards.name: Danitha Capashen, Paragon
cards.text:
First strike, vigilance, lifelink
Aura and Equipment spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Kenrith, the Returned King
cards.text:
{R}: All creatures gain trample and haste until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}{W}: Target player gains 5 life.
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card.
{4}{B}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Loran of the Third Path

Vigilance

{T}: You and target opponent each draw a card.

cards.text:
Lifelink

Whenever an opponent casts their second spell each turn, draw a card.

cards.text: Destroy target nonland permanent. Its controller creates a 1/1 white Human creature token.

cards.name: Wall of Omens
cards.text:

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Cryptic Command
cards.text:
Choose two -
• Counter target spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures your opponents control.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Laboratory Maniac
cards.text: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.

cards.name: Rhystic Study
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.

cards.name: Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir
cards.text:
Flash
Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield have flash.
Each opponent can cast spells only any time they could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Deadly Dispute
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw two cards and create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.")

cards.name: Diabolic Intent
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor
cards.text:
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may pay 1 life. If they do, they draw a card.
{4}{B}{B}{B}, Discard X cards: Exile the top X cards of target opponent's library. You may play lands and cast spells from among cards exiled this way without paying their mana costs.

cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Lifelink

cards.text:
Deathtouch

Haste
Whenever Captain Lannery Storm attacks, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.")
Whenever you sacrifice a Treasure, Captain Lannery Storm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Light Up the Stage
cards.text:
Spectacle {R} (You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost rather than its mana cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)
Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Mizzix's Mastery
cards.text:
Exile target card that's an instant or sorcery from your graveyard. For each card exiled this way, copy it, and you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost. Exile Mizzix's Mastery.
Overload {5}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change "target" in its text to "each.")

cards.name: Najeela, the Blade-Blossom
cards.text:
Whenever a Warrior attacks, you may have its controller create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token that's tapped and attacking.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Untap all attacking creatures. They gain trample, lifelink, and haste until end of turn. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase. Activate only during combat.

cards.name: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer
cards.text:
Whenever Ragavan deals combat damage to a player, create a Treasure token and exile the top card of that player's library. Until end of turn, you may cast that card.
Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.name: Carpet of Flowers
cards.text: At the beginning of each of your main phases, if you haven't added mana with this ability this turn, you may add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of Islands target opponent controls.

cards.name: Farseek
cards.text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, or Mountain card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Whenever a creature you control with deathtouch deals combat damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
